name: ARTHUR
text:
It is I, Arthur, son of Uther Pendragon, from 
        the castle of Camelot. King of the Britons, defeater of the Saxons, 
        Sovereign of all England!

name: ARTHUR
text:
I am, and this is my trusty servant Patsy. We 
        have ridden the length and breadth of the land in search of knights who 
        will join me in my court at Camelot. I must speak with your lord and 
        master.

name: SOLDIER #1
text:
You've got two empty halves of coconut and 
        you're bangin' 'em together.

name: ARTHUR
text:
So? We have ridden since the snows of winter 
        covered this land, through the kingdom of Mercia, through--

name: SOLDIER #1
text:
Found them? In Mercia? The coconut's 
        tropical!

name: SOLDIER #1
text: Well, this is a temperate zone.

name: ARTHUR
text:
The swallow may fly south with the sun or the 
        house martin or the plover may seek warmer climes in winter, yet these 
        are not strangers to our land?

name: SOLDIER #1
text: What? A swallow carrying a coconut?

name: SOLDIER #1
text:
It's not a question of where he grips it! 
        It's a simple question of weight ratios! A five ounce bird could not 
        carry a one pound coconut.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Well, it doesn't matter. Will you go and tell 
        your master that Arthur from the Court of Camelot is here?

name: SOLDIER #1
text:
Listen. In order to maintain air-speed 
        velocity, a swallow needs to beat its wings forty-three times every 
        second, right?

name: SOLDIER #2
text: It could be carried by an African swallow!

name: SOLDIER #1
text:
Oh, yeah, an African swallow maybe, but not 
        a European swallow. That's my point.

name: SOLDIER #2
text: Oh, yeah, I agree with that.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Will you ask your master if he wants to join my 
        court at Camelot?!

name: SOLDIER #1
text:
But then of course, uh, African swallows are 
        non-migratory.

name: SOLDIER #1
text:
So, they couldn't bring a coconut back 
        anyway.

name: SOLDIER #2
text:
Wait a minute! Supposing two swallows 
        carried it together?

name: SOLDIER #1
text: No, they'd have to have it on a line.

name: SOLDIER #2
text:
Well, simple! They'd just use a strand of 
        creeper!

name: SOLDIER #1
text:
What, held under the dorsal guiding 
        feathers?

name: CUSTOMER
text: Well, he will be soon. He's very ill.

name: CUSTOMER
text: No, you're not. You'll be stone dead in a moment.

name: CART MASTER
text:
Oh, I can't take him like that. It's against 
        regulations.

name: DEAD PERSON
text: I don't want to go on the cart!

name: CUSTOMER
text: Oh, don't be such a baby.

name: CUSTOMER
text:
Well, can you hang around a couple of minutes? He 
        won't be long.

name: CART MASTER
text:
No, I've got to go to the Robinsons'. They've 
        lost nine today.

name: DEAD PERSON
text: I think I'll go for a walk.

name: CUSTOMER
text:
You're not fooling anyone, you know. Look. Isn't 
        there something you can do?

name: CART MASTER
text: Not at all. See you on Thursday.

name: CART MASTER
text: I dunno. Must be a king.

name: CART MASTER
text: He hasn't got shit all over him.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Man. Sorry. What knight lives in that castle over 
        there?

name: ARTHUR
text: Well, I can't just call you 'Man'.

name: ARTHUR
text: Well, I didn't know you were called 'Dennis'.

name: DENNIS
text: Well, you didn't bother to find out, did you?

name: ARTHUR
text:
I did say 'sorry' about the 'old woman', but from the 
        behind you looked--

name: DENNIS
text:
What I object to is that you automatically treat me 
        like an inferior!

name: DENNIS
text:
Oh, King, eh, very nice. And how d'you get that, eh? 
        By exploiting the workers! By 'anging on to outdated imperialist dogma 
        which perpetuates the economic and social differences in our society. If 
        there's ever going to be any progress with the--

name: WOMAN
text:
Dennis, there's some lovely filth down here. Oh! How 
        d'you do?

name: ARTHUR
text:
How do you do, good lady? I am Arthur, King of the 
        Britons. Who's castle is that?

name: ARTHUR
text:
Well, we all are. We are all Britons, and I am your 
        king.

name: WOMAN
text:
I didn't know we had a king. I thought we were an 
        autonomous collective.

name: DENNIS
text:
You're fooling yourself. We're living in a 
        dictatorship: a self-perpetuating autocracy in which the working 
        classes--

name: WOMAN
text: Oh, there you go bringing class into it again.

name: DENNIS
text:
That's what it's all about. If only people would hear 
        of--

name: ARTHUR
text:
Please! Please, good people. I am in haste. Who lives 
        in that castle?

name: DENNIS
text:
I told you. We're an anarcho-syndicalist commune. We 
        take it in turns to act as a sort of executive officer for the week,...

name: DENNIS
text:
...but all the decisions of that officer have to be 
        ratified at a special bi-weekly meeting...

name: DENNIS
text:
...by a simple majority in the case of purely internal 
        affairs,...

name: DENNIS
text:
...but by a two-thirds majority in the case of more 
        major--

name: ARTHUR
text: Be quiet! I order you to be quiet!

name: WOMAN
text: Order, eh? Who does he think he is? Heh.

name: WOMAN
text: Well, I didn't vote for you.

name: WOMAN
text: Well, how did you become King, then?

name: DENNIS
text:
Listen. Strange women lying in ponds distributing 
        swords is no basis for a system of government. Supreme executive power 
        derives from a mandate from the masses, not from some farcical aquatic 
        ceremony.

name: DENNIS
text:
Well, but you can't expect to wield supreme executive 
        power just 'cause some watery tart threw a sword at you!

name: DENNIS
text:
I mean, if I went 'round saying I was an emperor just 
        because some moistened bint had lobbed a scimitar at me, they'd put me 
        away!

name: ARTHUR
text: Shut up, will you? Shut up!

name: DENNIS
text: Ah, now we see the violence inherent in the system.

name: DENNIS
text:
Oh! Come and see the violence inherent in the system! 
        Help! Help! I'm being repressed!

name: DENNIS
text:
Oh, what a give-away. Did you hear that? Did you hear 
        that, eh? That's what I'm on about. Did you see him repressing me? You 
        saw it, didn't you?

name: ARTHUR
text: You fight with the strength of many men, Sir Knight.

name: ARTHUR
text:
I have no quarrel with you, good Sir Knight, but I 
        must cross this bridge.

name: ARTHUR
text: I command you, as King of the Britons, to stand aside!

name: ARTHUR
text:
Eh. You are indeed brave, Sir Knight, but the fight is 
        mine.

name: ARTHUR
text: Look, you stupid bastard. You've got no arms left.

name: BLACK KNIGHT
text: Right. I'll do you for that!

name: ARTHUR
text: What are you going to do, bleed on me?

name: BLACK KNIGHT
text:
The Black Knight always triumphs! Have at you! 
        Come on, then.

name: BLACK KNIGHT
text: Oh? All right, we'll call it a draw.

name: BLACK KNIGHT
text:
Oh. Oh, I see. Running away, eh? You yellow 
        bastards! Come back here and take what's coming to you. I'll bite your 
        legs off!

name: CROWD
text:
A witch! A witch! A witch! A witch! We've found a 
        witch! A witch! A witch! A witch! A witch! We've got a witch! A witch! A 
        witch! Burn her! Burn her! Burn her! We've found a witch! We've found a 
        witch! A witch! A witch! A witch!

name: VILLAGER #1
text: We have found a witch. May we burn her?

name: CROWD
text: Burn her! Burn! Burn her! Burn her!

name: BEDEVERE
text: How do you know she is a witch?

name: WITCH
text: I'm not a witch. I'm not a witch.

name: BEDEVERE
text: Uh, but you are dressed as one.

name: WITCH
text: They dressed me up like this.

name: WITCH
text: And this isn't my nose. It's a false one.

name: VILLAGER #1
text: Well, we did do the nose.

name: VILLAGER #1
text: And the hat, but she is a witch!

name: CROWD
text: We burn her! Right! Yeaaah! Yeaah!

name: BEDEVERE
text: Did you dress her up like this?

name: BEDEVERE
text: What makes you think she is a witch?

name: VILLAGER #3
text: Well, she turned me into a newt.

name: BEDEVERE
text:
Quiet! Quiet! Quiet! Quiet! There are ways of 
        telling whether she is a witch.

name: BEDEVERE
text: Tell me. What do you do with witches?

name: BEDEVERE
text: And what do you burn apart from witches?

name: BEDEVERE
text: So, how do we tell whether she is made of wood?

name: VILLAGER #1
text: Build a bridge out of her.

name: BEDEVERE
text: Ah, but can you not also make bridges out of stone?

name: CROWD
text: The pond! Throw her into the pond!

name: VILLAGER #1
text:
If... she... weighs... the same as a duck,... 
        she's made of wood.

name: VILLAGER #4
text: Here is a duck. Use this duck.

name: BEDEVERE
text: Very good. We shall use my largest scales.

name: CROWD
text:
Ohh! Ohh! Burn the witch! Burn the witch! Burn her! 
        Burn her! Burn her! Burn her! Burn her! Burn her! Burn her! Ahh! Ahh...

name: CROWD
text: A witch! A witch! A witch!

name: CROWD
text: Burn her! Burn her! Burn her! Burn! Burn!...

name: BEDEVERE
text: Who are you who are so wise in the ways of science?

name: ARTHUR
text: I am Arthur, King of the Britons.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Good Sir Knight, will you come with me to Camelot and 
        join us at the Round Table?

name: BEDEVERE
text: My liege! I would be honored.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Then I dub you 'Sir Bedemere, Knight of the Round 
        Table'.

name: NARRATOR
text:
The wise Sir Bedevere was the first to join King 
        Arthur's knights, but other illustrious names were soon to follow: Sir 
        Lancelot the Brave, Sir Gallahad the Pure, and Sir Robin 
        the-not-quite-so-brave-as-Sir-Lancelot, who had nearly fought the Dragon 
        of Angnor, who had nearly stood up to the vicious Chicken of Bristol, 
        and who had personally wet himself at the Battle of Badon Hill, and the 
        aptly named Sir Not-appearing-in-this-film. Together they formed a band 
        whose names and deeds were to be retold throughout the centuries: The 
        Knights of the Round Table.

name: SIR BEDEVERE
text:
And that, my liege, is how we know the earth to 
        be banana-shaped.

name: ARTHUR
text:
This new learning amazes me, Sir Bedevere. Explain 
        again how sheep's bladders may be employed to prevent earthquakes.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Shh! Knights, I bid you welcome to your new home. Let 
        us ride... to... Camelot!

name: MAN
text: I have to push the pram a lot.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Well, on second thought, let's not go to Camelot. It 
        is a silly place.

name: GOD
text: Arthur! Arthur, King of the Britons! Oh, don't grovel!

name: GOD
text:
And don't apologize. Every time I try to talk to someone 
        it's 'sorry this' and 'forgive me that' and 'I'm not worthy'.

name: ARTHUR
text: I'm averting my eyes, O Lord.

name: GOD
text:
Well, don't. It's like those miserable Psalms-- they're 
        so depressing. Now, knock it off!

name: GOD
text:
Right! Arthur, King of the Britons, your Knights of the 
        Round Table shall have a task to make them an example in these dark 
        times.

name: LANCELOT
text: A blessing! A blessing from the Lord!

name: ARTHUR
text:
It is King Arthur, and these are my Knights of the 
        Round Table. Whose castle is this?

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
This is the castle of my master, Guy de 
        Loimbard.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Go and tell your master that we have been charged by 
        God with a sacred quest. If he will give us food and shelter for the 
        night, he can join us in our quest for the Holy Grail.

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
Well, I'll ask him, but I don't think he'll be 
        very keen. Uh, he's already got one, you see.

name: GALAHAD
text: He says they've already got one!

name: ARTHUR
text: Are you sure he's got one?

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
Oh, yes. It's very nice-a. (I told him we 
        already got one.)

name: ARTHUR
text: Well, u-- um, can we come up and have a look?

name: FRENCH GUARD
text: Of course not! You are English types-a!

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
I'm French! Why do think I have this outrageous 
        accent, you silly king-a?!

name: GALAHAD
text: What are you doing in England?

name: ARTHUR
text:
If you will not show us the Grail, we shall take your 
        castle by force!

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
You don't frighten us, English pig-dogs! Go and 
        boil your bottom, sons of a silly person. I blow my nose at you, 
        so-called Arthur King, you and all your silly English k-nnnnniggets. 
        Thpppppt! Thppt! Thppt!

name: ARTHUR
text: Now look here, my good man--

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
I don't wanna talk to you no more, you empty 
        headed animal food trough wiper! I fart in your general direction! Your 
        mother was a hamster and your father smelt of elderberries!

name: GALAHAD
text: Is there someone else up there we could talk to?

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
No. Now, go away, or I shall taunt you a second 
        time-a!

name: ARTHUR
text:
Now, this is your last chance. I've been more than 
        reasonable.

name: ARTHUR
text: If you do not agree to my commands, then I shall--

name: FRENCH GUARD
text: Hey, this one is for your mother! There you go.

name: FRENCH GUARD
text: And this one's for your dad!

name: BEDEVERE
text: Sir! I have a plan, sir.

name: BEDEVERE
text:
Well, now, uh, Lancelot, Galahad, and I, uh, wait 
        until nightfall, and then leap out of the rabbit, taking the French, uh, 
        by surprise. Not only by surprise, but totally unarmed!

name: BEDEVERE
text:
U-- u-- uh, Lancelot, Galahad, and I, uh, leap out 
        of the rabbit, uh, and uh...

name: BEDEVERE
text:
Oh. Um, l-- look, i-- i-- if we built this large 
        wooden badger--

name: KNIGHTS
text:
Run away! Run away! Run away! Run away! Run away! Run 
        away! Run away!

name: FRENCH GUARDS
text: Oh, haw haw haw haw! Haw! Haw haw heh...

name: NARRATOR
text:
The Tale of Sir Robin. So, each of the knights went 
        their separate ways. Sir Robin rode north, through the dark forest of 
        Ewing, accompanied by his favorite minstrels.

name: SIR ROBIN
text:
That's-- that's, uh-- that's enough music for now, 
        lads. Heh. Looks like there's dirty work afoot.

name: DENNIS
text: Anarcho-syndicalism is a way of preserving freedom.

name: WOMAN
text:
Oh, Dennis, forget about freedom. We haven't got enough 
        mud.

name: ROBIN
text:
Shut up! Um, n-- n-- n-- nobody, really. I'm 
        j-- j-- j-- ju-- just, um-- just passing through.

name: ROBIN
text:
Shut up! Um, oo, a-- nothing. Nothing, really. I, uh-- 
        j-- j-- just-- just to, um-- just to p-- pass through, good Sir Knight.

name: ROBIN
text:
Ah. W-- well, actually I-- I am a Knight of the Round 
        Table.

name: ALL HEADS
text: You're a Knight of the Round Table?

name: LEFT HEAD
text: In that case, I shall have to kill you.

name: RIGHT HEAD
text: Oh, let's be nice to him.

name: LEFT HEAD
text:
And you. Oh, quick! Get the sword out. I want to 
        cut his head off!

name: RIGHT HEAD
text: Oh, cut your own head off!

name: MIDDLE HEAD
text: Yes, do us all a favor!

name: MIDDLE HEAD
text: You're lucky. You're not next to him.

name: LEFT HEAD
text: Oh, I don't. Anyway, you've got bad breath.

name: MIDDLE HEAD
text: Well, it's only because you don't brush my teeth.

name: RIGHT HEAD
text: Oh, stop bitching and let's go have tea.

name: LEFT HEAD
text:
Oh, all right. All right. All right. We'll kill him 
        first and then have tea and biscuits.

name: LEFT HEAD
text:
All right. All right, not biscuits, but let's kill 
        him anyway.

name: GALAHAD
text: Open the door! Open the door!

name: GALAHAD
text: In the name of King Arthur, open the door!

name: ZOOT
text:
Welcome, gentle Sir Knight. Welcome to the Castle 
        Anthrax.

name: ZOOT
text:
Yes. Oh, it's not a very good name, is it? Oh, but we 
        are nice and we will attend to your every, every need!

name: GALAHAD
text: You are the keepers of the Holy Grail?

name: ZOOT
text:
Oh, but you are tired and you must rest awhile. Midget! 
        Crapper!

name: ZOOT
text: Prepare a bed for our guest.

name: MIDGET and CRAPPER
text:
Oh, thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Thank 
        you! Thank you! Thank you!...

name: ZOOT
text:
Away! Away, varletesses. The beds here are warm and soft 
        and very, very big.

name: ZOOT
text: What is your name, handsome knight?

name: ZOOT
text: Mine is 'Zoot'. Just 'Zoot'. Oh, but come.

name: GALAHAD
text: Look, please! In God's name, show me the Grail!

name: ZOOT
text: Oh, you have suffered much. You are delirious.

name: GALAHAD
text: No, look. I have seen it! It is here in this--

name: ZOOT
text:
Sir Galahad! You would not be so ungallant as to refuse 
        our hospitality.

name: ZOOT
text:
Oh, I am afraid our life must seem very dull and quiet 
        compared to yours. We are but eight score young blondes and brunettes, 
        all between sixteen and nineteen-and-a-half, cut off in this castle with 
        no one to protect us. Oooh. It is a lonely life: bathing, dressing, 
        undressing, knitting exciting underwear. We are just not used to 
        handsome knights. Nay. Nay. Come. Come. You may lie here. Oh, but you 
        are wounded!

name: ZOOT
text:
Oh, you must see the doctors immediately! No, no, 
        please! Lie down.

name: PIGLET
text: Well, what seems to be the trouble?

name: ZOOT
text: Uh, they... have a basic medical training, yes.

name: ZOOT
text:
Oh, come. Come. You must try to rest. Doctor Piglet! 
        Doctor Winston! Practise your art.

name: GALAHAD
text: Are you sure that's absolutely necessary?

name: GALAHAD
text: Look! This cannot be. I am sworn to chastity.

name: PIGLET
text: Back to your bed! At once!

name: GALAHAD
text: Torment me no longer. I have seen the Grail!

name: GALAHAD
text: I have seen it! I have seen it!

name: GIRLS
text:
Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. 
        Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. 
        Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello. Hello.

name: DINGO
text: No, I am Zoot's identical twin sister, Dingo.

name: GALAHAD
text:
I seek the Grail! I have seen it, here in this 
        castle!

name: DINGO
text: Oh, no. Oh, no! Bad, bad Zoot!

name: DINGO
text:
Oh, wicked, bad, naughty Zoot! She has been setting 
        alight to our beacon, which, I have just remembered, is grail-shaped. 
        It's not the first time we've had this problem.

name: DINGO
text:
Oh, wicked, bad, naughty, evil Zoot! She is a bad 
        person and must pay the penalty! Do you think this scene should have 
        been cut? We were so worried when the boys were writing it, but now, 
        we're glad. It's better than some of the previous scenes, I think.

name: LEFT HEAD
text: At least ours was better visually.

name: DENNIS
text:
Well, at least ours was committed. It wasn't just a 
        string of pussy jokes.

name: DINGO
text: Oh, I am enjoying this scene.

name: DINGO
text:
You must spank her well, and after you have spanked 
        her, you may deal with her as you like, and then, spank me.

name: DINGO
text: Yes. Yes, you must give us all a good spanking!

name: GIRLS
text:
A spanking! A spanking! There is going to be a spanking 
        tonight!

name: DINGO
text: And after the spanking, the oral sex.

name: GIRLS
text: The oral sex! The oral sex!

name: GALAHAD
text: Well, I could stay a bit longer.

name: GALAHAD
text: You know, she's got a point.

name: LANCELOT
text: Come on! We will cover your escape!

name: GALAHAD
text: No. Look, I can tackle this lot single-handed!

name: DINGO
text: Yes! Let him tackle us single-handed!

name: GIRLS
text: Yes! Let him tackle us single-handed!

name: GALAHAD
text:
No! Really! Honestly, I can cope. I can handle this 
        lot easily.

name: DINGO
text: Oh, yes. Let him handle us easily.

name: GIRLS
text: Yes. Let him handle us easily.

name: GALAHAD
text:
Please! I can defeat them! There's only a 
        hundred-and-fifty of them!

name: DINGO
text: Yes! Yes, he will beat us easily! We haven't a chance.

name: GIRLS
text: We haven't a chance. He will beat us easily...

name: LANCELOT
text:
We were in the nick of time. You were in great 
        peril.

name: LANCELOT
text: Yes, you were. You were in terrible peril.

name: GALAHAD
text: Look, let me go back in there and face the peril.

name: GALAHAD
text:
Look, it's my duty as a knight to sample as much 
        peril as I can.

name: LANCELOT
text: No, we've got to find the Holy Grail. Come on!

name: GALAHAD
text: Oh, let me have just a little bit of peril?

name: NARRATOR
text:
Sir Lancelot had saved Sir Galahad from almost 
        certain temptation, but they were still no nearer the Grail. Meanwhile, 
        King Arthur and Sir Bedevere, not more than a swallow's flight away, had 
        discovered something. Oh, that's an unladen swallow's flight, obviously. 
        I mean, they were more than two laden swallows' flights away-- four, 
        really, if they had a coconut on a line between them. I mean, if the 
        birds were walking and dragging--

name: NARRATOR
text:
Oh, anyway. On to scene twenty-four, which is a 
        smashing scene with some lovely acting, in which Arthur discovers a 
        vital clue, and in which there aren't any swallows, although I think you 
        can hear a starling-- oooh!

name: OLD MAN
text:
Heh, hee ha ha 
        hee hee! Hee hee hee ha ha ha...

name: ARTHUR
text:
And this enchanter of whom you speak, he has seen the 
        Grail?

name: OLD MAN
text:
...Ha ha ha ha! Heh, hee ha ha hee! Ha hee ha! Ha ha 
        ha ha...

name: ARTHUR
text: Old man, where does he live?

name: OLD MAN
text:
...Hee ha ha ha. He knows of a cave, a cave which no 
        man has entered.

name: ARTHUR
text: And the Grail. The Grail is there?

name: OLD MAN
text:
There is much danger, for beyond the cave lies the 
        Gorge of Eternal Peril, which no man has ever crossed.

name: ARTHUR
text: But the Grail! Where is the Grail?!

name: OLD MAN
text: Seek you the Bridge of Death.

name: ARTHUR
text: The Bridge of Death, which leads to the Grail?

name: OLD MAN
text: Heh, hee hee hee hee! Ha ha ha ha ha! Hee ha ha...

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text: We are the Knights Who Say... 'Ni'!

name: ARTHUR
text: No! Not the Knights Who Say 'Ni'!

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text:
We are the keepers of the sacred words: 'Ni', 
        'Peng', and 'Neee-wom'!

name: ARTHUR
text: Those who hear them seldom live to tell the tale.

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text: The Knights Who Say 'Ni' demand a sacrifice.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Knights of Ni, we are but simple travellers who seek 
        the enchanter who lives beyond these woods.

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text:
We shall say 'ni' again to you if you do not 
        appease us.

name: ARTHUR
text: Well, what is it you want?

name: ARTHUR
text: Please! Please! No more! We will find you a shrubbery.

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text:
You must return here with a shrubbery, or else, 
        you will never pass through this wood... alive.

name: ARTHUR
text:
O Knights of Ni, you are just and fair, and we will 
        return with a shrubbery.

name: FATHER
text: One day, lad, all this will be yours!

name: FATHER
text:
No. Not the curtains, lad. All that you can see, 
        stretched out over the hills and valleys of this land! This'll be your 
        kingdom, lad.

name: HERBERT
text: B-- b-- but Father, I don't want any of that.

name: FATHER
text:
Listen, lad. I built this kingdom up from nothing. 
        When I started here, all there was was swamp. Other kings said I was 
        daft to build a castle on a swamp, but I built it all the same, just to 
        show 'em. It sank into the swamp. So, I built a second one. That sank 
        into the swamp. So, I built a third one. That burned down, fell over, 
        then sank into the swamp, but the fourth one... stayed up! And that's 
        what you're gonna get, lad: the strongest castle in these islands.

name: HERBERT
text: But I don't want any of that. I'd rather--

name: FATHER
text:
Stop that! Stop that! You're not going into a song 
        while I'm here. Now listen, lad. In twenty minutes, you're getting 
        married to a girl whose father owns the biggest tracts of open land in 
        Britain.

name: HERBERT
text: B-- but I don't want land.

name: FATHER
text:
'Erbert. We live in a bloody swamp. We need all the 
        land we can get.

name: HERBERT
text: But-- but I don't like her.

name: FATHER
text:
Don't like her?! What's wrong with her?! She's 
        beautiful. She's rich. She's got huge... tracts o' land!

name: HERBERT
text:
I know, but I want the-- the girl that I marry to 
        have...

name: FATHER
text:
Cut that out! Cut that out! Look, you're marrying 
        Princess Lucky, so you'd better get used to the idea!

name: GUARD #1
text: Not to leave the room even if you come and get him.

name: FATHER
text: No, no. Until I come and get him.

name: GUARD #1
text:
Until you come and get him, we're not to enter the 
        room.

name: FATHER
text:
No, no. No. You stay in the room and make sure he 
        doesn't leave.

name: GUARD #1
text: And you'll come and get him.

name: GUARD #1
text:
We don't need to do anything apart from just stop 
        him entering the room.

name: GUARD #1
text:
Oh, if-- if-- if, uhh-- if-- if-- w-- ehh-- i-- if-- 
        if we--

name: FATHER
text:
You just stay here and make sure 'e doesn't leave the 
        room. All right?

name: GUARD #1
text: Oh, I remember. Uhh, can he leave the room with us?

name: FATHER
text:
N-- no, no. No. You just keep him in here and make 
        sure he--

name: GUARD #1
text:
Oh, yes. We'll keep him in here, obviously, but if 
        he had to leave and we were with him--

name: FATHER
text: No, no, no, no. Just keep him in here--

name: FATHER
text: No, not anyone else. Just me.

name: GUARD #1
text: Right. We'll stay here until you get back.

name: FATHER
text: And, uh, make sure he doesn't leave.

name: GUARD #1
text:
Ah. I thought you meant him. You know, it seemed a 
        bit daft me havin' to guard him when he's a guard.

name: FATHER
text:
No, no. I want you to stay here and make sure 'e 
        doesn't leave.

name: FATHER
text: Shut your noise, you! And get that suit on!

name: FATHER
text: Oh, go and get a glass of water.

name: LANCELOT
text:
And again! Over we go! Good. Steady! And now, the 
        big one! Uuh! Come on, Concorde!

name: LANCELOT
text:
Concorde! Concorde! Speak to me! 'To whoever finds 
        this note: I have been imprisoned by my father, who wishes me to marry 
        against my will. Please, please, please come and rescue me. I am in the 
        Tall Tower of Swamp Castle.' At last! A call! A cry of distress! This 
        could be the sign that leads us to the Holy Grail! Brave, brave 
        Concorde, you shall not have died in vain!

name: CONCORDE
text: Uh, I'm-- I'm not quite dead, sir.

name: LANCELOT
text:
Well, you shall not have been mortally wounded in 
        vain!

name: CONCORDE
text: I-- I-- I think I c-- I could pull through, sir.

name: CONCORDE
text:
Actually, I think I'm all right to come with you, 
        sir--

name: LANCELOT
text:
No, no, sweet Concorde! Stay here! I will send help 
        as soon as I have accomplished a daring and heroic rescue in my own 
        particular...

name: CONCORDE
text: No, I feel fine, actually, sir.

name: CONCORDE
text:
I'll, um-- I'll just stay here, then. Shall I, sir? 
        Yeah.

name: LANCELOT
text:
Ha ha! And take this! Aah! Hiyah! Aah! Aaah! Hyy! 
        Hya! Hiyya! Ha!...

name: GUARD #1
text: Now, you're not allowed to enter the room-- aaugh!

name: LANCELOT
text:
O fair one, behold your humble servant, Sir 
        Lancelot of Camelot. I have come to take y-- Oh, I'm terribly sorry.

name: LANCELOT
text: Uh, well, I-- I got, uh, a note.

name: LANCELOT
text: Uh, well, no. You see, I hadn't--

name: HERBERT
text:
I knew someone would. I knew that somewhere out 
        there...

name: FATHER
text: Stop that! Stop that! Stop it! Stop it! Who are you?

name: LANCELOT
text: Uh, I am Sir Lancelot, sir.

name: HERBERT
text: He's come to rescue me, Father.

name: LANCELOT
text: Well, let's not jump to conclusions.

name: FATHER
text: Did you kill all those guards?

name: LANCELOT
text:
Well, I'm awfully sorry. Um, I really can explain 
        everything.

name: HERBERT
text:
Don't be afraid of him, Sir Lancelot. I've got a 
        rope all ready.

name: FATHER
text: You killed eight wedding guests in all!

name: LANCELOT
text:
Well, uh, you see, the thing is, I thought your son 
        was a lady.

name: FATHER
text:
Shut up! You only killed the bride's father, that's 
        all!

name: LANCELOT
text: Well, I really didn't mean to...

name: FATHER
text:
Didn't mean to?! You put your sword right through his 
        head!

name: LANCELOT
text: Oh, dear. Is he all right?

name: FATHER
text:
You even kicked the bride in the chest! This is going 
        to cost me a fortune!

name: LANCELOT
text:
Well, I can explain. I was in the forest, um, 
        riding north from Camelot, when I got this note, you see--

name: FATHER
text: Camelot? Are you from, uh, Camelot?

name: LANCELOT
text: Uh, I am a Knight of King Arthur, sir.

name: FATHER
text: Very nice castle, Camelot. Uh, very good pig country.

name: FATHER
text: Would you, uh, like to come and have a drink?

name: LANCELOT
text: Well, that-- that's, uh, awfully nice of you,...

name: LANCELOT
text: ...um, I mean to be so understanding.

name: LANCELOT
text:
...I'm afraid when I'm in this idiom, I sometimes 
        get a bit, uh, sort of carried away.

name: FATHER
text:
Well, this is the main hall. We're going to have all 
        this knocked through and made into one big, uh, living room.

name: LANCELOT
text: Ha ha ha! Hey! Ha ha!

name: FATHER
text:
Hold it! Stop it! Hold it! Hold it! Hold it! Hold it! 
        Hold it! Please!

name: LANCELOT
text:
Sorry. Sorry. You see what I mean? I just get 
        carried away. I'm really most awfully sorry. Sorry! Sorry, everyone.

name: FATHER
text:
Hold it! Hold it! Please! Hold it! This is Sir 
        Lancelot from the Court of Camelot, a very brave and influential 
        knight, and my special guest here today.

name: FATHER
text:
Please! Please! This is supposed to be a happy 
        occasion! Let's not bicker and argue about who killed who. We are here 
        today to witness the union of two young people in the joyful bond of the 
        holy wedlock. Unfortunately, one of them, my son Herbert, has just 
        fallen to his death.

name: FATHER
text:
But I don't want to think I've not lost a son, so much 
        as... gained a daughter!

name: FATHER
text: Since the near fatal wounding of her father--

name: FATHER
text:
For, since her own father, who, when he seemed about 
        to recover, suddenly felt the icy hand of death upon him.

name: FATHER
text:
And I want his only daughter to look upon me as her 
        old dad, in a very real and legally binding sense.

name: FATHER
text: You fell out of the Tall Tower, you creep!

name: HERBERT
text: No, I was saved at the last minute.

name: FATHER
text: Not like that! Not like that! No! Stop it!

name: LANCELOT
text: No! It's not right for my idiom!

name: LANCELOT
text:
Excuse me. Could, uh-- could somebody give me a 
        push, please?

name: CRONE
text: Aggh! No! Never! We have no shrubberies here.

name: ARTHUR
text:
If you do not tell us where we can buy a shrubbery, my 
        friend and I will say... we will say... 'ni'.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Very well! If you will not assist us voluntarily,... 
        ni!

name: ARTHUR
text: No, no. 'Ni'. You're not doing it properly. No.

name: ARTHUR
text: That's it. That's it. You've got it.

name: ROGER THE SHRUBBER
text: Are you saying 'ni' to that old woman?

name: ROGER
text:
Oh, what sad times are these when passing ruffians can 
        say 'ni' at will to old ladies. There is a pestilence upon this land. 
        Nothing is sacred. Even those who arrange and design shrubberies are 
        under considerable economic stress at this period in history.

name: ROGER
text:
Yes. Shrubberies are my trade. I am a shrubber. My name 
        is 'Roger the Shrubber'. I arrange, design, and sell shrubberies.

name: ARTHUR
text:
O Knights of Ni, we have brought you your shrubbery. 
        May we go now?

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text:
It is a good shrubbery. I like the laurels 
        particularly,... but there is one small problem.

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text: We are now... no longer the Knights Who Say 'Ni'.

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text:
Shh! We are now the Knights Who Say 
        'Ecky-ecky-ecky-ecky-pikang-zoop-boing-goodem-zu-owly-zhiv'.

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text: Therefore, we must give you a test.

name: ARTHUR
text:
What is this test, O Knights of-- knights who till 
        recently said 'ni'?

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text: Firstly, you must find... another shrubbery!

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text:
Then, when you have found the shrubbery, you must 
        place it here beside this shrubbery, only slightly higher so you get the 
        two-level effect with a little path running down the middle.

name: KNIGHTS OF NI
text:
A path! A path! A path! Ni! Shh! Knights of Ni! 
        Ni! Ni! Shh! Shh!...

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text:
Then, when you have found the shrubbery, you must 
        cut down the mightiest tree in the forest... with... a herring!

name: ARTHUR
text: We shall do no such thing!

name: ARTHUR
text: Cut down a tree with a herring? It can't be done.

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text: Augh! Ohh! Don't say that word.

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text:
I cannot tell, suffice to say is one of the words 
        the Knights of Ni cannot hear.

name: ARTHUR
text:
How can we not say the word if you don't tell us what 
        it is?

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text:
No, not 'is'. You wouldn't get vary far in life 
        not saying 'is'.

name: ROBIN
text: My liege! It's good to see you.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Surely you've not given up your quest for the Holy 
        Grail?

name: ROBIN
text: Shut up! No, no. No. Far from it.

name: ROBIN
text: Uh, here-- here in this forest.

name: ARTHUR
text: No, it is far from this place.

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text: Aaaaugh! Stop saying the word! The word...

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text: ...we cannot hear! Ow! He said it again!

name: HEAD KNIGHT
text: Wait! I said it! I said it!

name: NARRATOR
text:
And so, Arthur and Bedevere and Sir Robin set out on 
        their search to find the enchanter of whom the old man had spoken in 
        scene twenty-four. Beyond the forest, they met Lancelot and Galahad, and 
        there was much rejoicing.

name: NARRATOR
text:
In the frozen land of Nador, they were forced to eat 
        Robin's minstrels.

name: NARRATOR
text:
...and Winter gave Spring and Summer a miss and went 
        straight on into Autumn.

name: KNIGHTS
text: Eh. Oh. See it? Oh. Oh.

name: ARTHUR
text: By what name are you known?

name: TIM
text: There are some who call me... 'Tim'?

name: ARTHUR
text:
That is our quest. You know much that is hidden, O 
        Tim.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Yes, we're-- we're looking for the Holy Grail. Our 
        quest is to find the Holy Grail.

name: KNIGHTS
text: Yeah. Yes. It is. It is. Yeah. Yup. Yup. Hm. Mm.

name: ARTHUR
text: And so, we're-- we're-- we're looking for it.

name: BEDEVERE
text: We have been for some time.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Uh-- uh, so, uh, anything that you could do to, uh-- 
        to help... would be... very... helpful.

name: GALAHAD
text: Look, can you tell us where--

name: ARTHUR
text:
Fine. Um, I don't want to waste any more of your time, 
        but, uh, I don't suppose you could, uh, tell us where we might find a, 
        um-- find a, uh-- a, um-- a, uh--

name: ARTHUR
text: A g-- a-- a g-- a g-- a-- a g--

name: ARTHUR
text: Look, um, you're a busy man, uh--

name: TIM
text: Yes, I can help you find the Holy Grail.

name: TIM
text:
To the north there lies a cave-- the cave of Caerbannog-- 
        wherein, carved in mystic runes upon the very living rock, the last 
        words of Olfin Bedwere of Rheged...

name: ARTHUR
text: Where could we find this cave, O Tim?

name: TIM
text:
Follow. But! Follow only if ye be men of valour, for the 
        entrance to this cave is guarded by a creature so foul, so cruel that no 
        man yet has fought with it and lived! Bones of full fifty men lie strewn 
        about its lair. So, brave knights, if you do doubt your courage or your 
        strength, come no further, for death awaits you all with nasty, big, 
        pointy teeth.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Then we'd best leave them here and carry on on foot. 
        Dis-mount!

name: ARTHUR
text: You got us all worked up!

name: TIM
text:
That's the most foul, cruel, and bad-tempered rodent you 
        ever set eyes on!

name: ROBIN
text: You tit! I soiled my armor I was so scared!

name: TIM
text:
Look, that rabbit's got a vicious streak a mile wide! 
        It's a killer!

name: TIM
text: He'll do you up a treat, mate.

name: ROBIN
text: What's he do, nibble your bum?

name: TIM
text:
He's got huge, sharp-- eh-- he can leap about-- look at 
        the bones!

name: ARTHUR
text: Go on, Bors. Chop his head off!

name: BORS
text:
Right! Silly little bleeder. One rabbit stew comin' 
        right up!

name: TIM
text:
I warned you, but did you listen to me? Oh, no, you knew 
        it all, didn't you? Oh, it's just a harmless little bunny, isn't it? 
        Well, it's always the same. I always tell them--

name: TIM
text: Ha ha ha ha! Ha haw haw! Ha! Ha ha!

name: ARTHUR
text: Right. How many did we lose?

name: ARTHUR
text:
Three. Three. And we'd better not risk another frontal 
        assault. That rabbit's dynamite.

name: ROBIN
text: Would it help to confuse it if we run away more?

name: ARTHUR
text: Oh, shut up and go and change your armor.

name: GALAHAD
text:
Let us taunt it! It may become so cross that it will 
        make a mistake.

name: LANCELOT
text: We have the Holy Hand Grenade.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Yes, of course! The Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch! 'Tis 
        one of the sacred relics Brother Maynard carries with him! Brother 
        Maynard! Bring up the Holy Hand Grenade!

name: ARTHUR
text: How does it, um-- how does it work?

name: BROTHER MAYNARD
text:
Armaments, chapter two, verses nine to 
        twenty-one.

name: SECOND BROTHER
text:
And Saint Attila raised the hand grenade up on 
        high, saying, 'O Lord, bless this Thy hand grenade that, with it, Thou 
        mayest blow Thine enemies to tiny bits in Thy mercy.' And the Lord did 
        grin, and the people did feast upon the lambs and sloths and carp and 
        anchovies and orangutans and breakfast cereals and fruit bats and large 
        chu--

name: SECOND BROTHER
text:
And the Lord spake, saying, 'First shalt thou 
        take out the Holy Pin. Then, shalt thou count to three. No more. No 
        less. Three shalt be the number thou shalt count, and the number of the 
        counting shall be three. Four shalt thou not count, nor either count 
        thou two, excepting that thou then proceed to three. Five is right out. 
        Once the number three, being the third number, be reached, then, lobbest 
        thou thy Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch towards thy foe, who, being 
        naughty in My sight, shall snuff it.'

name: ARTHUR
text: Brother Maynard! You are a scholar.

name: MAYNARD
text:
It reads, 'Here may be found the last words of Joseph 
        of Arimathea. He who is valiant and pure of spirit may find the Holy 
        Grail in the Castle of aaarrrrggh'.

name: MAYNARD
text: He must have died while carving it.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Look, if he was dying, he wouldn't bother to carve 
        'aarrggh'. He'd just say it!

name: MAYNARD
text: Well, that's what's carved in the rock!

name: ARTHUR
text: Oh, shut up. Well, does it say anything else?

name: BEDEVERE
text: Do you suppose he meant the Camaaaaaargue?

name: LANCELOT
text: Isn't there a 'Saint Aaauuves' in Cornwall?

name: LANCELOT
text:
No, no. 'Aaaauugggh', at the back of the throat. 
        Aaauugh.

name: BEDEVERE
text:
N-- no. No, no, no, no. 'Oooooooh', in surprise and 
        alarm.

name: LANCELOT
text: Oh, you mean sort of a 'aaaah'!

name: MAYNARD
text: It's the legendary Black Beast of Aaarrrrggh!

name: NARRATOR
text:
As the horrendous Black Beast lunged forward, escape 
        for Arthur and his knights seemed hopeless, when suddenly, the animator 
        suffered a fatal heart attack.

name: NARRATOR
text:
The cartoon peril was no more. The quest for Holy 
        Grail could continue.

name: ARTHUR
text: Look! There's the old man from scene twenty-four!

name: ARTHUR
text:
He is the keeper of the Bridge of Death. He asks each 
        traveller five questions--

name: ARTHUR
text: Three questions. He who answers the five questions--

name: ARTHUR
text: Three questions may cross in safety.

name: ROBIN
text: What if you get a question wrong?

name: ARTHUR
text: Then you are cast into the Gorge of Eternal Peril.

name: GALAHAD
text: Who's going to answer the questions?

name: ROBIN
text: Hey! I've got a great idea. Why doesn't Lancelot go?

name: LANCELOT
text:
Yes. Let me go, my liege. I will take him 
        single-handed. I shall make a feint to the north-east that s--

name: ARTHUR
text:
No, no. No. Hang on! Hang on! Hang on! Just answer the 
        five questions--

name: ARTHUR
text:
Three questions as best you can, and we shall watch... 
        and pray.

name: ARTHUR
text: Good luck, brave Sir Lancelot. God be with you.

name: BRIDGEKEEPER
text:
Stop! Who would cross the Bridge of Death must 
        answer me these questions three, ere the other side he see.

name: LANCELOT
text:
Ask me the questions, bridgekeeper. I am not 
        afraid.

name: LANCELOT
text: My name is 'Sir Lancelot of Camelot'.

name: LANCELOT
text: Oh, thank you. Thank you very much.

name: BRIDGEKEEPER
text:
Stop! Who approacheth the Bridge of Death must 
        answer me these questions three, ere the other side he see.

name: ROBIN
text: Ask me the questions, bridgekeeper. I'm not afraid.

name: BRIDGEKEEPER
text: What... is the capital of Assyria?

name: BRIDGEKEEPER
text: Hee hee heh. Stop! What... is your name?

name: ARTHUR
text: It is 'Arthur', King of the Britons.

name: BRIDGEKEEPER
text:
What... is the air-speed velocity of an unladen 
        swallow?

name: ARTHUR
text: What do you mean? An African or European swallow?

name: BRIDGEKEEPER
text: Huh? I-- I don't know that. Auuuuuuuugh!

name: BEDEVERE
text: How do know so much about swallows?

name: ARTHUR
text:
Well, you have to know these things when you're a 
        king, you know.

name: ARTHUR
text:
The Castle Arrrggh. Our quest is at an end! God be 
        praised! Almighty God, we thank Thee that Thou hast vouchsafed to us the 
        most holy--

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
Allo, dappy English k-niggets and Monsieur 
        Arthur King, who has the brain of a duck, you know. So, we French 
        fellows outwit you a second time!

name: ARTHUR
text:
How dare you profane this place with your presence! I 
        command you, in the name of the Knights of Camelot, to open the doors of 
        this sacred castle, to which God Himself has guided us!

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
How you English say, 'I one more time, mac, 
        unclog my nose in your direction', sons of a window-dresser! So, you 
        think you could out-clever us French folk with your silly knees-bent 
        running about advancing behavior?! I wave my private parts at your 
        aunties, you cheesy lot of second hand electric donkey-bottom biters.

name: ARTHUR
text:
In the name of the Lord, we demand entrance to this 
        sacred castle!

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
No chance, English bed-wetting types. I burst my 
        pimples at you and call your door-opening request a silly thing, you 
        tiny-brained wipers of other people's bottoms!

name: ARTHUR
text:
If you do not open this door, we shall take this 
        castle by force!

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
Yes, depart a lot at this time and cut the 
        approaching any more, or we fire arrows at the tops of your heads and 
        make castanets out of your testicles already! Ha ha haaa ha!

name: FRENCH GUARD
text:
And now, remain gone, illegitimate-faced 
        bugger-folk! And, if you think you got a nasty taunting this time, you 
        ain't heard nothing yet, dappy English k-nnniggets! Thpppt!

name: ARTHUR
text:
Today the blood of many a valiant knight shall be 
        avenged. In the name of God,...

name: FRENCH GUARDS
text: Hoo hoo! Ohh, ha ha ha ha ha!...

name: ARTHUR
text:
...we shall not stop our fight till each one of you 
        lies dead and the Holy Grail returns to those whom God has chosen!

name: HISTORIAN'S WIFE
text: Yes, they're the ones. I'm sure.

name: INSPECTOR
text: Come on. Anybody armed must go, too.

name: OFFICER #1
text: Just... pull it off. Come on. Come along.

name: INSPECTOR
text: Put this man in the van.

name: INSPECTOR
text: Come on. Put him in the van.

name: OFFICER #1
text: Come on. Back. Riiight back. Come on!

name: OFFICER #1
text:
Pull that off. My, that's an offensive weapon, 
        that is.

name: OFFICER #2
text: Come on. Back with 'em. Back. Right. Come along.

name: OFFICER #1
text:
All right, sonny. That's enough. Just pack that 
        in.
